> I have been given an introductory Java module to teach. The module
> as it runs at present uses the BlueJ environment. I have it in the 
back
> of my mind to introduce some Test-Driven Development. Does anyone 
here know
> ( or better use ) a BlueJ environment that has been embellished 
with JUnit 
> support ?

I can tell you that we are working on a version of BlueJ
with integrated support for unit testing.. the plan is for
it to be released before the end of the year (hopefully
a beta by the end of september).

With the current version, adding the junit.jar through
the "preferences / libraries" preferences panel will make the junit 
classes available, but then there is the problem of make the swing 
runner interface available to the student.. I imagine a simple class 
could be written that wraps around the swingrunner class that allows 
an interactive method call to bring the dialog up.. give me a few 
days to think about it and I might be able to make something 
available on the bluej website resources section to help out.

Andrew
